flow.descriptionCdata:
6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.169fdfbd-4e00-437e-8650-674864aa86dc.prompt=Enter a value for Destination Host 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.1ebad291-72a6-42a5-af03-905285f9ebf3.prompt=Enter a value for Source Host 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.21bb4087-5fe9-44d6-ba0d-946d345f8ebb.prompt=Enter a value for password 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.28c03dc8-dc40-4915-afed-5443ddbddc32.prompt=Enter a value for Destination Username 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.4182c438-f0c0-4cd3-8c32-62573c180edc.prompt=Enter a value for File Names 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.561bfd89-4124-4fd7-8dba-637f1da4d3a9.prompt=Enter a value for Source Path 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.6d89f382-5b20-4ea7-9e84-6ca69e131821.prompt=Enter a value for Source Host 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.701688b9-f448-4471-be50-d6166237245b.prompt=Enter a value for Destination Password 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.8bbd5866-a558-4ee1-a849-5a23c909e2cd.prompt=Enter a value for Destination Username 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.8bd4a2ae-39d9-43c4-acb4-3caa0eaedf78.description=This flow detects the operating system that is running on the specified host. Inputs\: host - The hostname or IP address of the target machine. port - The port number. Default value\: 22 username - The username to connect to the target machine. password - The password to connect to the target machine. Results\: returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the output of a "uname -a; uname -m; domainname" for Unix based hosts, and the result of a Nmap command "nmap -sS -sU -O -Pn --top-ports 20" for a Windows host. returnCode - The return code of the operation. Valid values\: 32 for a Windows operating system, 18 for Linux, 19 for Solaris, 20 for other operating system, -1 for failure. osName - The completely returned string of the OS name. For Windows target host, this will be an heuristic result. Example\: Microsoft Windows 7, Windows Server 2012, or Windows 8.1 Update 1 version - The operating systems version. For Unix systems, this result contains the kernel release version. For Windows systems, this will be empty. hostName - The host name that the remote computer reports for itself. osArchitecture - The operating system architecture. For Windows systems, this will be empty. Examples\: x86_64 for Linux, i86pc for Solaris fqdn - The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the target machine. For Windows systems, this will be empty. Responses\: windows - The operating system is Windows. linux - The operating system is Linux. solaris - The operating system is Solaris. other - Other operating system. failure - The operating system on the remote host could not be detected. Notes\: 1. This operation uses Nmap ("Network Mapper") for Windows target machine, an open source tool for network exploration and security auditing. Nmap must be installed on source machine (Studio/Central/RAS) from http\://nmap.org. 2. The Nmap OS detection is heuristic, based on the TCP/IP stack fingerprinting and network traffic. Nmap sends a series of TCP and UDP packets to the remote host and examines practically every bit in the responses. After performing dozens of tests such as TCP ISN sampling, TCP options support and ordering, IP ID sampling, and the initial window size check, Nmap compares the results to its nmap-os-db database of more than 2,600 known OS fingerprints and prints out the OS details if there is a match. When Nmap performs OS detection against a target and fails to find a perfect match, it usually repeats the attempt. By default, Nmap tries five times if conditions are favorable for OS fingerprint submission, and twice when conditions aren't so good. 3. For Windows RAS, the HP Operations Orchestration Central/RAS service must be run with Administrator priviledges. 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.960afbd8-f743-4fb3-8292-f0eadfe420e9.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.9db5232d-e6bb-4226-a3b0-7e54fa89908c.prompt=Enter a value for File Names 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.bc80d3ea-aa42-4162-951c-f39e67a1a05d.prompt=Enter a value for host 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.bf4415f8-eb80-4f08-8860-22589ab25f70.prompt=Enter a value for Destination Password 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.c35f358b-0523-4892-a7e6-f907eaff6716.prompt=Enter a value for username 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.ccbba5f5-e903-45f0-b962-7cfd1fa3530e.description= Inputs\: command - executes DownloadfromSAStep.py FileNames - required\: The list of files separated by comma that needs to be downloaded from the SA TargetDir - Required\: The directory where the files will be downloaded host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching. 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.cf0de772-3055-48ae-9419-57241a0ce23f.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.d5460d76-274c-411b-8196-32f03bf17a4b.prompt=Enter a value for Destination Host 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.description=

Description 
This workflow installs the OO Runtime packs onto the target machine by copying them from a source host(file server) and extracting them onto the target

Supported Platforms\:
Windows,Linux

Required Inputs
Source Host - The source machine from which the OO Runtime packs will be copied
Source Path - The absolute path of the OO Runtime packs present in the source host
File Names - The name of the OO Runtime packs in the source host
Source Username - The user to login to the source host as
Source Password - The password to login to as the Source Username
Destination Host - The destination host where the OO Runtime packs will be installed
Destination Username - The user to login to the destination host
Destination Password - The password to login to as the destination username	

Dependencies
The OO Runtime packs should be present in the source host/file server before executing this flow

Results\:
  success - The operation was executed successfully.
  failure - The operation failed to run
6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.dfb67c98-a97a-4095-a038-8db513d81765.prompt=Enter a value for Source Path 6cedd319-baa7-4b09-a5e5-455b87e230b8.e2dd3947-e50e-4d04-8ff1-6512340b6361.description= Inputs\: command - executes DownloadfromSAStep.py FileNames - required\: The list of files separated by comma that needs to be downloaded from the SA TargetDir - Required\: The directory where the files will be downloaded host - Target to run this command against password - Login information for host username - Login information for host protocol - ssh/wmi timeout - Time (ms) before auto-exit\: use ${ExtendedTimeout} to lengthen. Results\: Exit Code - Exit code of the step needed for branching.
flow.name: DMA Remote Copy
